title: How to Measure Autonomy

title: IIT Plantoid Project
synopsis: An example of a plantoid in active research was demonstrated by Dr Mazzolai of the Italian Institute of Technology, in Pontedera plans during a conference at the [[Natural History Museum in London]] on July 29th 2013.

title: Observational Autonomy
synopsis: The American Military make an assessment of [[Unmanned Aerial Vehicles]] with regard their observational autonomy on an 11 point rating scale.

title: OODA Loop
synopsis: The phrase OODA loop refers to the decision cycle of observe, orient, decide, and act, developed by military strategist and USAF Colonel John Boyd - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OODA_loop wikipedia]

title: Plantoid
synopsis: A plantoid is a hypothetical robot or synthetic organism designed to look, act and grow like a plant.

title: Rhizome
synopsis: In botany and dendrology, a rhizome is a modified subterranean stem of a plant that is usually found underground, often sending out roots and shoots from its nodes.

title: Robot Plant
synopsis: Robotots usually move, but a robot plant moves like a plant. It may turn slowly towards the sun, or it may be still. However it breathes, in captures energy, and it produces. It is alive.

title: Robot Plant Desings
synopsis: Here I outline a few thoughts about potential designs for the first and [[Future Plantoids]].

title: The Power of Plants
synopsis: When looking at a garden, meadow or forest, that half of almost every plant in it is underground.

title: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle
synopsis: An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), known in the mainstream as a [[Drone]], is an aircraft without a human pilot aboard.

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to this site about my work on the [[Plantoid]] project. This site is a place where I document my thoughts, designs and code as they develop.
